content: begin the next stitch in the new color pull the loose end of the color you took off the hook to remove the spare loop leave the working yarn for the color not being used hanging on the wrong side of the work until needed again copyright emily korff not for distribution or duplication 3 the back of the work will look something like this slip_stitch or sew the two ends together to connect copyright emily korff not for distribution or duplication 4 hat now we will create the main part of the hat attaching it to the ribbing the sample hat was about 7 5 tall with the blue portion measuring about 5 5 row 1 rs blue single_crochet evenly around the top of the ribbing slip_stitch to the first stitch chain 1 turn row 2 ws blue 1 single_crochet into each stitch around slip_stitch into the first stitch ch1 turn row 3 rs blue with white carried along 2 single_crochet 1 vsc repat the pattern in the brackets all the way around until the last stitch single_crochet into beginning stitch chain 1 turn row 4 ws repeat row 2 row 5 rs blue with white carried along 1 single_crochet 1vsc 2sc repeat the pattern in the brackets all the way around until the last stitch single_crochet into beginning stitch chain 1 turn note these should be offset from the vs in the line above if they aren t add another single_crochet before beginning the repeat repeat row 2-5 until the desired hat height copyright emily korff not for distribution or duplication 5 this is how the inside of the work will look as the white thread is carried along finishing fold the hat so that the seam is on the side sew or slip_stitch the top of the hat together weave in loose ends copyright emily korff not for distribution or duplication 6
